channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: From mortgage fraud to magic mushrooms: Inside the mysterious world of Shaman Shu
item.description: Robert Shumake featured in scandals that brought down ex-Detroit Mayor Kwame Kilpatrick and Ebony magazine. Now he’s charged in a scheme involving a m...

item.title: The Score: Tesla, Alphabet, JPMorgan Chase and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: JPMorgan Calls It: The U.S. Economy Has Made a Soft Landing
item.description: The bank reported better-than-expected third-quarter results, a sign that the economy is chugging along as the Fed lowers interest rates.

item.title: ‘No one writes about “rich guy” early-retirement quandaries’: My wife and I earn $300K and have $3.75 million saved. We have 3 kids. When can I quit working?
item.description: “I am looking to exit full-time work, enjoy my family and have a better quality of life.”

item.title: Can Nvidia have another blowout year in 2025?
item.description: Also: New ways to learn about financial risks before buying a home, thoughts on the bull market for stocks and an in-depth look at food prices.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Series
item.description: Check out the stocks Heard on the Street writers favor in their eighth annual stock-picking contest.

item.title: Hurricanes Helene and Milton walloped parts of the U.S. What will they do to GDP?
item.description: Hurricanes Milton and Helene put lots of people out of work temporarily and could add upward pressure to inflation, but the storms are unlikely to put...

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 0.36% This Week to 97.58
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index gained 0.36% in the week, its second consecutive weekly gain, and was little changed Friday.

item.title: Soft Landing or Hard? Bank Results Show Path to No Landing
item.description: Comments from JPMorgan and Wells Fargo suggest the economy could stay airborne.

item.title: China’s finance minister says there is room for more economic stimulus but offers few details
item.description: China’s finance minister on Saturday said the country will “significantly increase” debt issuance to counter slow economic growth, stabilize the prope...
